Precision at every axis

CNC Capabilities

End-to-end machining, programming, and support for the most demanding industrial environments.

Multi-Axis Milling

3, 4 & 5-axis CNC milling for complex geometries, tight-tolerance aerospace and automotive components.

  • 3-Axis
  • 4-Axis
  • 5-Axis
  • High-Speed

CNC Turning

High-precision turning of shafts, bushings, and rotational parts in steel, aluminum, and exotic alloys.

EDM & Wire Cutting

Electrical discharge machining for hardened tool steels, dies, and intricate internal profiles.

±0.001mm

Achievable tolerance on CNC machined components

CNC Programming

CAM programming with Mastercam, Siemens NX, and Fanuc/Mitsubishi/Okuma controllers. Rapid post-processing for any machine brand.

  • Mastercam
  • Siemens NX
  • Fanuc
  • Mitsubishi

Laser Cutting & Marking

Fiber laser cutting and part-marking with traceability codes, logos, and serial numbers on all metals.

CMM Inspection

In-process and final CMM dimensional verification ensuring every part meets print requirements before delivery.

15+yrs

CNC support experience in the automotive sector

What we deliver

CNC Services

Ball Bar Test:

Diagnostic evaluation of CNC machine tool performance using a ball bar instrument to measure and report circularity errors, backlash, and servo mismatch.

Axis Interpolation:

Verification and correction of multi-axis motion coordination to ensure smooth, accurate contouring and minimize positional deviation during complex machining cycles.

Custom Precision Shim Fabrication:

Design and manufacture of precision shims to exact tolerances, correcting machine geometry, bearing preloads, and alignment offsets for optimal spindle and axis performance.

Geometric Alignment & Machine Leveling:

Full geometric alignment including squareness, straightness, and flatness checks using laser trackers and electronic levels to restore machine accuracy to OEM specifications.

Success Stories

How we solved real challenges for industry leaders

Challenge

"Our stamping line had frequent unplanned stops due to outdated PLC logic, costing us over 40 hours of downtime per month."

Solution
✔

"EDS redesigned the entire control architecture, migrated to a modern PLC platform, and added predictive diagnostics — downtime dropped by 87% in the first quarter."

Ford Motor Company Stamping Plant — Automotive Manufacturing
Challenge

"We needed to automate our coil handling process without interrupting ongoing steel production. A complete integration with zero production downtime was the requirement."

Solution
✔

"EDS engineered a fully automated coil transfer system with robotic arms and safety-certified interlocks, deployed during scheduled maintenance windows. Production efficiency increased by 32%."

ArcelorMittal Steel Production — Heavy Industry
Challenge

"Our assembly line robots lacked real-time communication with the MES system, creating data gaps and making traceability nearly impossible for quality audits."

Solution
✔

"EDS implemented a custom OPC-UA integration layer connecting all robotic cells to the MES in real time. Full traceability achieved — audit compliance reached 100% on the first review."

Hitachi Assembly Automation — Electronics Manufacturing
Challenge

"Manual torque verification on our drivetrain assembly was causing cycle time bottlenecks and occasional escapes to the end-of-line test, impacting overall OEE."

Solution
✔

"EDS automated the torque verification station with servo-driven tooling and integrated error-proofing sensors. Cycle time reduced by 22% and zero escapes recorded in six months."

General Motors Drivetrain Assembly — Automotive
Challenge

"Our hydraulic power unit control panels were aging and no longer supported by the manufacturer, creating serious risks of unplanned outages across multiple facilities."

Solution
✔

"EDS executed a phased panel modernization program across 3 facilities, replacing legacy components with current-gen hardware and fully documented SCADA dashboards. Zero production impact during migration."

Eaton Corporation Power Management — Industrial Controls
Challenge

"A new model launch required integrating a high-precision welding cell into an existing line in under 6 weeks, with no tolerance for delays given the production ramp schedule."

Solution
✔

"EDS delivered a fully commissioned welding cell — mechanical, electrical, and programming — in 5 weeks. The line launched on schedule and hit target cycle time on the first production run."
